author: James Joyce
text: Dear Aunt Josephine: Thanks for your letter but I cannot manage what you suggest till you write me more explicitly who are the persons and also tell me what was the rumour concerning me to which you alluded a long time ago. Can you inform me when Yeats married? My play will be produced tomorrow night in Munich with one of the best actresses on the German stage in the leading part. I have received a number of telegrams inviting me to be present but nowadays it is difficult to travel anywhere except in a trance. I shall let you know how it gets on. Please write in reply. Jim P.S. Please address clearly: Universitätstrasse [sic] 29.
